title: Thames Valley Police force suspends chief
text: comments Thames Valley Police Superintendent Gez Chiariello is facing an investigation A police chief who left his wife and moved in with an officer almost 15 years younger than him was today suspended amid allegations of gross misconduct. Thames Valley Police Superintendent Gez Chiariello is facing an investigation into claims said to include allegations over his interaction with women. Mr Chiariello, 46, who was the commander of the force's Milton Keynes police area, is about to become a father with his new partner PC Jess Lomax. A probe by the force's professional standards department investigation will possibly lead to a disciplinary hearing that could see him sacked. Mr Chiariello's police Twitter account was closed this week, and sources said he had been sent home from work and was looking after Miss Lomax. There is mention on her Instagram account in recent weeks of a baby shower where friends have been guessing the unborn baby's weight, gender and date of birth. Mr Chiariello was among one of the district's 'celebrities' who took part in a charity dancing event last November (pictured) where he raised almost Â£2,000 for a hospice Detective Chief Inspector Debbie Leonard will now be stepping up to the role of Acting Superintendent after Mr Chiariello was suspended. And Deputy Chief Constable John Campbell said: 'The alleged breaches of standards are in relation to authority, respect and courtesy and discreditable conduct and have been determined as meeting the threshold in respect of gross misconduct.
